newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Astra helps lift Swedish shares to record high.
newsitem.headline: Astra helps lift Swedish shares to record high.

text.p: A late rally in drugs major Astra helped lift Swedish shares higher on Friday.
The exchange's general index rose 1.28 percent to a record high of 2,868.75 in turnover of 5.26 billion crowns.
Astra surged nine crowns to 351.5 in a recovery. It was the last day it traded before a bonus issue of one share for three and a split two for one.

"The effect of the split and the bonus issue will come after they have been done," one analyst said. "Today's upturn could be because Astra has had lower market capitilisation than its European rivals since its first quarter results."

Insurer Skandia rocketed 34 crowns to 285, lifted by rumours about a possible deal with Nordbanken and a successful initial public offering of Hartford Life Inc, a rival to its U.S. unit linked division AFS, which Skandia might list.
Telecoms group Ericsson rose 1.5 crowns to a new record close of 279, but came off an intra-day high of 282.
"Telecoms shares keep fairly quiet at the moment but a clear trend is that international investors are upgrading Nokia in comparison to Ericsson," a trader said.
Real estate group Castellum ended at 56 crowns in its first day of trade.
